creditline: Gift of Louis W. Hill, Jr.
inscription:
As I began to write the character for \"long life\" on New Year\'s Day, the dragon on the seal knob seized the brush, as if it were a spring jewel.
(Kotobuki to
Fude kokoromite
Inchu_ no
Tatsu mo tsukami shi
Tama no hatsuharu)
by Shunmintei Tanenari

I fill my brush with the fragrance of fresh ink and write the character for \"plum tree\" this morning as my first calligraphy.
(Suri sumi no
Nioi wo fude ni
Fukumasete
Ume to yu_ ji ya
Kesa no kakizome)
by Harunoya Naritake
medium: Woodblock print (surimono); ink and color on paper
title: (Seals, Carving Tools, Porcelain Ink Box and Plum Branch)
